Title: Liquid-Snake: Continuous-Time Geometric Deep Learning for Causal Neuro-Oncology
Hypothesis: We hypothesize that replacing standard convolutional blocks with 'Liquid-Snake' blocks—hybrid units combining Dynamic Snake Convolutions with Liquid Time-Constant (LTC) differential equation solvers—will significantly improve robustness to noise and irregular sampling in MRI data by modeling the brain tumor as a continuous dynamic system rather than a static image.
Experiment_Plan: 1. Implement `LiquidConv2D` layer using a semi-implicit Euler solver for the LTC dynamics. 2. Integrate this into the `NeuroSnake` backbone. 3. Compare `Liquid-Snake` vs `NeuroSnake-KAN` on noisy/corrupted Br35H data. 4. Analyze 'causal robustness' (performance drop under intervention).
Selected_Reason: Moving from discrete-layer neural networks to continuous-depth (ODE-based) Liquid Neural Networks represents a fundamental shift in the computational paradigm. This 'reinvention' directly addresses the fragility of standard deep learning in medical settings (noise, artifacts) by leveraging the inherent stability of dynamical systems.
